page.title: 20A day's visit.
page.content: Stoney Park Weavers is run by Mr. Noon and his wife. They weave in an old converted grain loft. They sell their cloth. By Kilgetty roundabout there is a Sports Club. It runs football teams and cricket and hockey. It has a social section. Mr. John past chairman of our P.T.A. is vice chairman and Kay Howells' father is chairman. Mr. Evans is steward of the R.O.A.B. Club in Kilgetty. It is a centre for meetings for example Old age pensioners and garden club. The Stage Coach Inn has stood on the old road for 300 years. It was there during the time of the Rebecca riots l830. Summerhill shop has more business in the summer. They run shops on a nearby caravan park. Lots of the caravans there, are owned by people from away. 4 people work there. Open from May to end of Sept.
